description: Restyle the plant monitor frontend from V1 (dark industrial) to V6 (Terminal Light) — white background, IBM Plex Mono, brutalist structure, green accents, inline readings

userStories.title: Set up Terminal Light design foundation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the CSS variables, font imports, and Ant Design theme tokens updated to match the Terminal Light design system before restyling components.
acceptanceCriteria: Import IBM Plex Mono (400, 500, 600, 700) from Google Fonts in index.html
Replace all CSS custom properties in app.css with the DESIGN.md color palette
Update Ant Design ConfigProvider in main.jsx: disable dark algorithm, set custom tokens (colorPrimary: #1a7a4f, fontFamily: IBM Plex Mono, borderRadius: 0, colorBgContainer: #ffffff)
Page background is white (#ffffff), all text renders in IBM Plex Mono
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: Read DESIGN.md for the full color palette. Remove JetBrains Mono and IBM Plex Sans references.

userStories.title: Restyle header to Terminal Light
userStories.description: As a user, I want the header to show the cv::plant_monitor branding with the facility name and live indicator in the new light style.
acceptanceCriteria: Header has white background, 2px solid #1a1a1a bottom border, 52px height
Left side shows 'cv::plant_monitor' (cv in green) + pipe separator + facility selector
Right side shows UTC timestamp and live dot with pulse animation in green
Facility selector dropdown is styled to match (monospace, subtle border)
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: See design-reference.html header section. The pipe separator is a styled span.

userStories.title: Add section labels with > prefix
userStories.description: As a user, I want clear section labels above each dashboard area that match the terminal aesthetic.
acceptanceCriteria: Each section (status, metrics, chart, assets) has a label above it
Labels are 10px, 700 weight, uppercase, 2.5px letter-spacing, color --text-3
Each label is prefixed with '> ' in --green color
Labels read: 'system status', 'facility metrics', 'time series', 'asset registry'
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: These can be a simple reusable SectionLabel component or just CSS class applied in App.jsx.

userStories.title: Restyle StatusOverview to pill format
userStories.description: As an operator, I want status counts displayed as individual tinted pills instead of a connected bar.
acceptanceCriteria: Status pills are individual elements in a flex row with 10px gap
Each pill shows count (24px, 700 weight) + label (10px, uppercase)
Operational pill: green border, #eaf6f0 background, green text
Warning pill: amber border, #fdf3e4 background, amber text
Critical and offline pills use default border with semantic text color
Total pill has default border, dark text
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: See DESIGN.md Status Pills section. Remove any Ant Design Card wrappers if present.

userStories.title: Restyle MetricCards with top accent lines
userStories.description: As an operator, I want metric cards on a white background with colored top accent lines and the // detail format.
acceptanceCriteria: Cards in a 4-column grid with 14px gap
Each card: 1px border, 20px padding, white background
3px colored top accent line (green for power, blue for consumption, amber for steam, neutral for others)
Label: 10px uppercase, --text-3
Value: 34px, 700 weight, --text. Unit: 14px, --text-3
Detail text uses // separator (e.g., '3 assets // avg 437.3')
Hover: border darkens
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: The accent line is a CSS ::before pseudo-element. See DESIGN.md Metric Cards section.

userStories.title: Restyle TimeSeriesChart to Terminal Light
userStories.description: As an operator, I want the chart area to match the light theme with proper line colors and styled time-range buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Chart container: 1px border, white background
Header shows metric name with green highlight text, time-range button strip on right
Time buttons: connected strip, monospace, active = black fill + white text, others = subtle border
Chart area: light grid lines (#f0eeea), axis labels in --text-4
Line colors: green (#1a7a4f) solid for primary, amber (#b06e14) dashed for secondary, blue (#3a6ba5) solid for tertiary
Gradient fills: 8% opacity, fading to transparent
Footer: --bg-subtle background with legend showing color bars + current values
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: Update Recharts stroke/fill props and the CSS around the chart. See DESIGN.md chart spec.

userStories.title: Restyle AssetTable with inline readings (Option A)
userStories.description: As an operator, I want to see asset readings as inline label-value pairs with full metric names, not boxed chips with abbreviations.
acceptanceCriteria: Table uses proper HTML table (or Ant Table) with styled header
Header row: --bg-subtle background, 2px bottom border, 9px uppercase labels
Body rows: 16px vertical padding, 1px bottom border, hover = --bg-subtle
Asset name: 700 weight. Type: 11px uppercase, --text-3
Status: colored dot (7px) + text in matching color
Readings: inline flex-wrap pairs — 'Temperature 542.8 °C' not 'Temp 542.8°C'
Reading labels: 12px, 500 weight, --text-3. Values: 12px, 700, --text. Units: 11px, 400, --text-4
Full metric names used everywhere (Temperature, Power Output, Flow Rate, Vibration, Pressure, Efficiency, Steam Flow, Voltage, Current)
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: This is the most important visual change. See DESIGN.md anti-patterns — NO boxed chips, NO abbreviated labels. The formatMetricName() utility should map snake_case API names to proper display names.

userStories.title: Add page footer and final polish
userStories.description: As a user, I want a clean footer and consistent spacing across all sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer: 1px top border, 10px text in --text-4
Left: 'cv::plant_monitor v1.0 // fastapi + react + ant design'
Right: 'polling: 15s // data gen: 30s'
Consistent 36px gap between sections
Content area max-width 1400px, centered, 32px horizontal padding
No remaining dark-mode artifacts (dark backgrounds, light-on-dark text)
npm run build passes
userStories.notes: Final pass. Check every component against design-reference.html. Verify with Playwright if available.
